data.title: 1922 ORIGINAL TITLE LOBBY CARD "ROUGH SHOD" / BUCK JONES / SILENT WESTERN MOVIE by CHARLES (BUCK) JONES (Star): Very Good Plus (1922) First Edition.
data.meta_description: First Edition. - William Fox, Hollywood - 1922 - Condition: Very Good Plus - 4-mil clear mylar envelope - This is an ORIGINAL title lobby card for the film, "ROUGH SHOD" starring Buck Jones (Billed as "Charles Jones"), Helen Ferguson, Ruth Renick, Maurice "Lefty" Flynn and Jack Rollins. Card Stock. 11"x14". Buck Jones (1891-1942) was one of the greatest of the "B" Western film stars. Tragically, he died of injuries sustained in the 1942 Cocoant Grove nightclub fire in Boston. A Very Good Plus copy (pinholes at corners; some toning at borders; tiny chips at two corners), now in a clear 4mil mylar protective envelope. FREE SHIPPING to any United States address. - 1922 ORIGINAL TITLE LOBBY CARD "ROUGH SHOD" / BUCK JONES / SILENT WESTERN MOVIE
